description: Slow cooker BBQ shredded chicken is an easy weeknight dinner that can be made with chicken breasts, thighs, or a combo of the two.
headline: Recipe: Slow Cooker BBQ Shredded Chicken

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Leftovers will keep for up to 4 days stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator or 3 months in the freezer.

name: Recipe: Slow Cooker BBQ Shredded Chicken
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, thighs, or a combination

recipeInstructions.text: Season the chicken all over with the salt and pepper. Place in a 6-quart or larger slow cooker, pour in 1 1/2 cups of the barbecue sauce, and stir to combine. Cover and cook until the chicken is cooked through and tender, 5 hours on the LOW setting or 3 hours on the HIGH setting.

Transfer the chicken out of the sauce to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. (Alternatively, use an electric hand mixer and large bowl.) Mix at medium speed until the chicken is shredded, about 15 seconds. Return the chicken to the slow cooker, add the remaining 1/2 cup barbecue sauce, and stir to combine.

video.description: I speak from experience when I tell you that once you make a batch of saucy BBQ shredded chicken in your slow cooker, you'll never make it another way again. If you're already doing this, you know exactly what I'm talking about. It's a weeknight win that delivers juicy shredded meat infused with a smoky-sweet sauce. You get all that by tossing some chicken and BBQ sauce in the slow cooker. Eat it paired with your favorite sides, layered on a pillowy roll, or stuffed in a taco, then freezer the leftovers for another night.
video.name: Barbecue Shredded Chicken
